title: 106_s2776
content: The "Medical Research Investment Act of 2000" increases the limitation on charitable deduction for contributions for medical research. The "Medical Research Investment Act of 2000" increases the limitation on charitable deduction for contributions for medical research to 80 percent of the taxpayer's contribution base for any taxable year. The "Medical Research Investment Act of 2000" raises the limit on charitable deductions for medical research contributions to 80% of the taxpayer's contribution base. Excess contributions are carried over for 10 years as medical research contributions. Capital gain property contributions are subject to specific rules. The "Medical Research Investment Act of 2000" increases the charitable deduction limit for medical research contributions to 80% of the taxpayer's contribution base. Excess contributions can be carried over for 10 years. Capital gain property contributions are subject to specific rules. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code to include medical research contributions. The "Medical Research Investment Act of 2000" amends the Internal Revenue Code to include medical research contributions. The amendments increase the charitable deduction limit for medical research contributions to 80% of the taxpayer's contribution base. Contributions made after December 31, 2000, are subject to the new rules, while contributions made before that date are eligible for deductions under certain conditions. SEC. 3. Treatment of certain incentive stock options. Treatment of incentive stock options under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include an exception for certain medical research stock transfers. This exception applies to stock traded on an established securities market. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include an exception for medical research stock transfers, specifically for stock traded on a securities market. This exception applies to stock acquired through the exercise of an incentive stock option in the same taxable year as the transfer, and for stock considered a medical research contribution. The amendments made by this section apply to transfers of stock made after the date of the enactment of this Act.
